config_description: Number of keys from the counter cache to save Disabled by default, meaning all keys are going to be saved
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'counter_cache_keys_to_save' determines the number of keys from the counter cache that will be saved. By default, all keys are saved. The configuration is used in the initialization of the counter cache and in scheduling the saving of keys at a specified period.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered when the counter cache is scheduled to save keys. The frequency of triggering is determined by the value set in 'DatabaseDescriptor.getCounterCacheSavePeriod()'.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'counter_cache_keys_to_save' configuration option is on the storage size and performance of the system. Setting a higher value for this configuration may increase the storage space required to save keys from the counter cache, potentially impacting the overall performance of the system.
